item.title: NVIDIA DLSS Games Update: Assetto Corsa EVO, SMITE 2, Dynasty Warriors: Origins, and Honkai Star Rail
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/nvidia-dlss-games-update-assetto-corsa-evo-smite-2-dynasty-warriors-origins-and-honkai-star-rail/

The announcement of NVIDIA DLSS 4 at CES 2025 doesn't mean earlier versions of the Deep Learning Super Sampling upscaler aren't still being used. Today, NVIDIA provided an update on some PC games that are about to get support for DLSS Super Resolution (2.0), Frame Generation (3.0), and/or DLAA.

Both NVIDIA DLSS Super Resolution and Frame Generation are available in Tankhead, a roguelite vehicle shooter released last month on the Epic Games Store. In this game, players become Whitaker, the pilot of a drone-controlled Light Tank that can move quickly and deliver devastating damage with various weapons. The ultimate goal is traversing the Event Containment Area, where humans cannot survive, to reach the so-called Highpoint.

Starting today, DLSS Super Resolution, DLAA, and Reflex are also available in SMITE 2. Following the end of the Closed Alpha stage, the Unreal Engine 5 powered third-person action MOBA game has entered the Open Beta and is officially free to play on PC via Steam and Epic Games Store, as well as Sony's PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series S|X consoles. Developer Hi-Rez Studios has added five new gods with this update: Aladdin from Arabian myth, the Egyptian God of Earth Geb, the Chinese Ascendant Warrior Mulan, Agni from the Hindu Pantheon, and Ullr from the Norse Pantheon.

Tomorrow, HoYoverse will release update 3.0 for Honkai: Star Rail, MiHoYo's free-to-play science fantasy gacha game. The patch will add the new world of Amphoreus and a fresh chapter in the game's main story and introduce NVIDIA DLSS Super Resolution to the PC version, increasing frame rates for GeForce RTX users.

Italian developer KUNOS Simulazioni will release the highly anticipated racing simulation game Assetto Corsa EVO on early access in two days, on Thursday, January 16. The game features a vastly improved proprietary engine that supports a full 24-hour race cycle, advanced lighting, dynamic weather, and track conditions. It also supports VR and triple-screen Surround setups for maximum immersion. In both cases, users will be glad to know the game supports NVIDIA DLSS Super Resolution on day one as a frame rate booster.

The studio also shared the official system requirements. You can find them below.

Minimum:

    • OS: Windows 10 64-bit
    • Processor: Intel i7 8700k / AMD 1500X
    • Memory: 16 GB RAM
    • Graphics: GTX 1070, RX 580
    • DirectX: Version 12
    • Network: Broadband Internet connection
    • Storage: 100 GB available space
    • Sound Card: Integrated
    • VR Support: SteamVR, Oculus VR, OpenXR
    • Additional Notes: SSD required

Recommended:

    • OS: Windows 10 64-bit / Windows 11 64-bit
    • Processor: Intel i5 10500 / AMD 2600X
    • Memory: 16 GB RAM
    • Graphics: RTX 2070, Radeon RX 5600
    • DirectX: Version 12
    • Network: Broadband Internet connection
    • Storage: 100 GB available space
    • Sound Card: Integrated
    • VR Support: SteamVR, Oculus VR, OpenXR
    • Additional Notes: SSD required

Last but not least, Omega Force and KOEI TECMO's Dynasty Warriors: Origins will be released on Friday, January 17, with built-in support for NVIDIA DLSS Super Resolution and Frame Generation. This game's requirements can be found below, and our review of the PS5 version is available here.

Minimum:

    • OS: Windows 10/11 64-bit
    • Processor: Intel Core i5-8400 or higher, AMD Ryzen 5 2600 or higher
    • Memory: 12 GB RAM
    • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1060 (VRAM 6GB) or better, AMD Radeon RX 590 (VRAM 8GB) or better
    • DirectX: Version 12
    • Network: Broadband Internet connection
    • Storage: 50 GB available space
    • Sound Card: 16-bit stereo with 48KHz playback
    • Additional Notes: Based on a display resolution of 1920x1080 and a frame rate of 30FPS, with the Graphics Quality set to "Low" and the Texture Quality set to "Low." Note: Windows 11 system requirements apply when using that OS.

Recommended:

    • OS: Windows 10/11 64-bit
    • Processor: Intel Core i7-7700K or higher, AMD Ryzen 7 5700X or higher
    • Memory: 16 GB RAM
    • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2070 (VRAM 8GB) or better, AMD Radeon RX 5700 XT (VRAM 8GB) or better
    • DirectX: Version 12
    • Network: Broadband Internet connection
    • Storage: 50 GB available space
    • Sound Card: 16-bit stereo with 48KHz playback
    • Additional Notes: Based on a display resolution of 1920x1080 and a frame rate of 60FPS, with the Graphics Quality set to "High" and the Texture Quality set to "High." Note: - If you are using a widescreen monitor or a monitor with a resolution higher than Full HD, additional VRAM capacity may be required depending on your settings. - Windows 11 system requirements apply when using that OS.

item.title: Chernobylite 2: Exclusion Zone Kickstarter Campaign Launches Today; New Trailer Released
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/chernobylite-2-exclusion-zone-kickstarter-campaign-launches-today-new-trailer-released/

The Chernobylite 2: Exclusion Zone Kickstarter campaign is launching today to further expand the action role-playing game in development by The Farm 51 with new features, including a highly requested one.

Over the past few months, The Farm 51 listened to and analyzed fan feedback regarding the game, noticing how the switch from the first-person combat view of the first entry in the series to the new third-person perspective of the sequel was the most critical issue. As such, the studio decided to fix the issue by introducing a switchable third-person and first-person combat perspective, but to do so, it is asking fans for support. More information on the fundraising campaign can be found on the game's Kickstarter page.

To celebrate the beginning of the Chernobylite 2: Exclusion Zone Kickstarter campaign, The Farm 51 also released a new gameplay trailer showcasing some of the game's most prominent features. You can check out the trailer below.

Chernobylite 2: Exclusion Zone is aiming for a late 2025 release date. You can learn more about how the second entry in the series will expand the formula of its predecessor by checking out our interview with the game's Development Director conducted during Gamescom 2024.
